intro: Antherothamnus, commonly known as the sand thorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. The plants are shrubs or small trees with small, often spiny leaves and yellow or white flowers. They have adapted to harsh environments through deep root systems and drought-resistant foliage. Antherothamnus species are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
